content:
• Friday, May 31, 2013
  • UNXL

    Discussing the UniBoss touch sensor film sample pictures posted by SA contributor Seth Shaw in...

    Discussing the UniBoss touch sensor film sample pictures posted by SA contributor Seth Shaw in his bearish column on UniPixel (UNXL -22.9%), a source tells Barron's Tiernan Ray the sample unit is 18 months old and broken, and that UniPixel will show off a demo unit that "will work just fine" at an industry conference next week. The source also speculates UniPixel shares saw naked short selling today, given 9M shares were traded (more than an estimated float of 6M-7M). Shares closed down 59% from their May 16 close of $36.74.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:02 PM | 15 Comments
  • AZC

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: AZC +9%. ORI +6%. JASO +5%. THD +4%. CAW +4%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: AZC +9%. ORI +6%. JASO +5%. THD +4%. CAW +4%.
    After-hours top losers: NBG -2%. GDXJ -2%. KGC -2%. BYD -2%. AG -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • INFN

    Infinera (INFN +3.8%) closed up strongly today. Yesterday afternoon, SA contributor Inflection...

    Infinera (INFN +3.8%) closed up strongly today. Yesterday afternoon, SA contributor Inflection Point Investing made a detailed bull case. IPI argued the 100G optical transmission system market, where Infinera has an outsized share, is set to take off - Frost & Sullivan sees the market growing from $892M in 2012 to $4.8B in 2015 - and that Infinera's DTN-X systems are differentiated by their superior efficiency (aided by their use of OTN switching), unmatched scale (they support 500G channels, rivals are at 100G), and lower cost of ownership. The author also wonders if Infinera's recent secondary offering is meant to provide working capital to handle major orders from Verizon and/or Level 3.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM

  • The week's ETF movers - Gainers: GDXJ +7.5%. GDX +7.3%. URA +2.4%. VXX +2.4%. VNM +1.7%. ETF...

    The week's ETF movers - Gainers: GDXJ +7.5%. GDX +7.3%. URA +2.4%. VXX +2.4%. VNM +1.7%.
    ETF Losers: GAZ -8.9%. BRF -8.5%. EWZ -6.8%. UNG -6.7%. VNQ -5.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY) says it's received a determination letter from Nasdaq indicating that it...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY) says it's received a determination letter from Nasdaq indicating that it believes it should be delisted. Specifically, Nasdaq notified OTC:AFFY that it's operating as a “public shell,” since its voluntary recall of Omontys means the company essentially no longer has an operating business. OTC:AFFY doesn't plan to appeal. Shares -22% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM | 5 Comments
  • AFFY

    Shares of Affymax (OTC:AFFY +31.5%) soar today on the back of what appears to be a massive short...

    Shares of Affymax (OTC:AFFY +31.5%) soar today on the back of what appears to be a massive short squeeze. The most recent data on the stock has short interest rising 43% from the start to middle of May, with around 18.5M shares currently out on loan, or 50% of its float.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • CPHD

    Cepheid (CPHD -4.4%) slides after Jefferies analyst Brandon Couillard assumes coverage of the...

    Cepheid (CPHD -4.4%) slides after Jefferies analyst Brandon Couillard assumes coverage of the shares with a downgrade to Hold, but reiterates the $38 price target. Couillard says that the company is well-positioned for margin expansion over the longer term as it leverages investments in its R&D pipeline, launches new high-margined tests and captures greater manufacturing efficiencies, but present valuations are already reflecting these bullish growth expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • VALE

    Several Brazilian stocks hit 52-week lows in U.S. trading, as investors look to an early exit of...

    Several Brazilian stocks hit 52-week lows in U.S. trading, as investors look to an early exit of stimulus measures by the country's central bank, which intervened to stabilize the real. VALE -4.8%, SID -4.8%, GGB -4.8%. Petrobras (PBR -2.5%) also moves lower as it reports April production of 2.55M boe/day, up more than 2% from March but flat vs. the prior year.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 5 Comments
  • CRL

    Charles River Labs (CRL -1.6%) slips on a Raymond James downgrade to Underperform from Market...

    Charles River Labs (CRL -1.6%) slips on a Raymond James downgrade to Underperform from Market Perform. When asked about the move on CNBC earlier, Cramer said he doesn't agree. In the same segment, the Mad Money host called Guess' (GES +9%) Q1 "horrendous, but not horrendous enough" to keep the shares from rallying. (See also: GES earnings rundown)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -2%) is reinstated with a Neutral rating and $26 price target at Goldman...

    Chesapeake Energy (CHK -2%) is reinstated with a Neutral rating and $26 price target at Goldman Sachs, as the firm says favorable core positions in the Eagle Ford, Marcellus and Utica shales are offset by a funding gap that limits the pace of development. CHK may need to see larger-scale sales/separation of core acreage to receive market value/acre for key positions.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 5 Comments
  • FFHL

    Fuwei Films (FFHL +16.5%) pops today after the U.S. Court of International Trade finds its...

    Fuwei Films (FFHL +16.5%) pops today after the U.S. Court of International Trade finds its shipments didn't give rise to any anti-dumping duties for the period from November, 2008 to October, 2009. The company had filed an administrative lawsuit against the US Department of Commerce regarding an anti-dumping duty of 30.91% that had been imposed as a result of a review. After further scrutiny the court found the shipments resulted in a level of dumping that was "de minimis," which carries no associated anti-dumping duties, and ordered a refund the all monies plus interest.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • ICA

    Shares of Empresas ICA (ICA -6.6%) plunge after the Mexican company's deal to combine its home...

    Shares of Empresas ICA (ICA -6.6%) plunge after the Mexican company's deal to combine its home building business with privately-held Servicios Corporativos Javer is called off. The 180-day contractual period had expired without an agreement being reached. ICA had jumped 4.3% yesterday on the government’s decision to delay imposing new rules on its homebuilders.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM
  • MGPI

    MGP Ingredients (MGPI +7.1%) adds to yesterday's gains, putting its two-day rally at 21% after...

    MGP Ingredients (MGPI +7.1%) adds to yesterday's gains, putting its two-day rally at 21% after announcing that management is reviewing strategic alternatives. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM
  • ROAN

    Today's volatility in Linn Energy (LINE -2.3%) and LinnCo (LNCO -2.3%) apparently is traced to a...

    Today's volatility in Linn Energy (LINE -2.3%) and LinnCo (LNCO -2.3%) apparently is traced to a notice of effectiveness from the SEC over the proposed takeover of Berry Petroleum (BRY -2.4%). RBC analyst John Ragozzino says he has a "high degree" of conviction the deal still will close, though it could be delayed to mid-July.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 6 Comments
  • NSPH

    Nanosphere (NSPH +7.2%) pops today after Jefferies analyst Brandon Couillard assumes coverage...

    Nanosphere (NSPH +7.2%) pops today after Jefferies analyst Brandon Couillard assumes coverage with a Buy and raises his price target on the shares from $3.50 to $5.50. Couillard notes that NSPH's proprietary gram-positive blood stream infection test should drive significant new system placements and revenue growth over the next several years.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision's (OVTI +21.2%) post-earnings rally/short-squeeze continues, as investors on edge...

    OmniVision's (OVTI +21.2%) post-earnings rally/short-squeeze continues, as investors on edge over Apple welcome an FQ4 beat and strong FQ1 guidance. On the earnings call, OmniVision mentioned orders from Chinese OEMs, whose sales are growing rapidly at home and overseas, is offsetting weakness elsewhere, and that product mix changes are lifting margins (Apple is known for driving a hard bargain). However, management also cautioned it doesn't expect as big of a late-year demand increase as it saw last year. The automotive market is touted as a growth driver, as is OmniVision's CameraCubeChip sensor/lens module for low-end phones. Skyworks (SWKS +2.3%), which shares many customers with OmniVision, could be up in sympathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • PPP

    Brigus Gold (BRD -2.4%) resumes milling operations at its Black Fox mine after high water levels...

    Brigus Gold (BRD -2.4%) resumes milling operations at its Black Fox mine after high water levels in the holding and water management facilities had forced a suspension earlier this month. Underground and open pit mining operations were not affected, and BRD continued to stockpile ore which is now being processed at Black Fox.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM
  • KMP

    Kinder Morgan Partners (KMP -1.6%) cancels plans for the 277K bbl/day Freedom pipeline that...

    Kinder Morgan Partners (KMP -1.6%) cancels plans for the 277K bbl/day Freedom pipeline that would have given refiners on the U.S. west coast such as Valero (NYSE:VLO) and Tesoro (TSO) a direct stream of West Texas crude. KMP says it did not receive enough interest to commit to building the $2B project, and will switch its focus to crude-by-rail projects in Texas and California.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 3 Comments
  • HMA

    Health Management Associates (HMA +4%) move up amid chatter that fellow hospital operator...

    Health Management Associates (HMA +4%) move up amid chatter that fellow hospital operator Community Health (CYH +4.5%) might be looking to buy the company. Susquehanna says CYH's continued interest in acquiring assets with scale "implies it would be interested in acquiring HMA in a friendly, non- hostile process" though any deal is unlikely to be happen in the very near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • RENN

    Renren (RENN +3.6%) and Youku (YOKU -0.3%) are forming a content partnership, according to a...

    Renren (RENN +3.6%) and Youku (YOKU -0.3%) are forming a content partnership, according to a Chinese media report (translation). The deal will reportedly lead to the integration of Youku videos on Renren's social networking platform, and provide additional Renren sharing options for the videos. Renren, which already owns second-tier Chinese video site 56.com, is getting a lift from the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • NVLN

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR +6.4%) moves up today after the European Committee for Medicinal...

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR +6.4%) moves up today after the European Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use votes unanimously to adopt a positive opinion recommending marketing authorization for AEGR's cholesterol drug Lojuxa in hard capsule form. If approved, the drug will be indicated as an adjunct to a low-fat diet and other lipid-lowering medicinal products for patients with homozygous familial hypercholesterolemia.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • MLNX

    More on UBS' downgrade of Mellanox (MLNX -7.1%): Analyst Steve Milunovich is worried about...

    More on UBS' downgrade of Mellanox (MLNX -7.1%): Analyst Steve Milunovich is worried about Mellanox's plans to delist from the Tel Aviv exchange in 90 days, given an estimated 20%-25% of its shares are held in Israel, and the move could prompt Israeli ETFs/funds to jump ship. He also expects a motion to allow Eyal Waldman to remain both chairman and CEO to be voted down next week, forcing Mellanox to find a new chairman or CEO. Lazard is defending Mellanox, arguing the delisting will save the company $200K-$300K/year and will affect 4%-5% of shares at most.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • EFC

    Renewed selling hits mREITs (MORT -1.2%) as Treasury yields turn decidedly higher, TLT -0.8%....

    Renewed selling hits mREITs (MORT -1.2%) as Treasury yields turn decidedly higher, TLT -0.8%. Getting the worst of it today is Ellington Financial (EFC -3.3%) - a partnership, not a REIT; it's more trading shop, but still leveraged to credit and interest rates. It's recently IPOd mortgage REIT counterpart EARN -1.1%. Also notably lower is CYS Investments (CYS -2.6%), American Capital (AGNC -1.8%), (MTGE -1.5%), Annaly (NLY -1.3%), and Armour Residentail (ARR -1.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 15 Comments
  • GIGA

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTC:GIGA +29%. UPI +23%. OSH +22%. OVTI +19%. OTCQB:TELK +18%. LAS +18%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTC:GIGA +29%. UPI +23%. OSH +22%. OVTI +19%. OTCQB:TELK +18%. LAS +18%. HGSH +18%. KKD +17%. CEP +14%. MGCD +13%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: MNGA -22%. UNXL -19%. PLM -13%. PANW -9%. PW -9%. ECTY -9%. ICA -9%. RSOL -9%. NGD -9%. FSM -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM
  • JAZZ

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (JAZZ +0.9%) gets a bit of a lift from Stifel Nicolaus today, after...

    Jazz Pharmaceuticals (JAZZ +0.9%) gets a bit of a lift from Stifel Nicolaus today, after the broker inititates the shares with a Buy and an $80 price target. The firm says that the stock's fundamentals are sound, but valuation still prices in concerns regarding the near to medium-term threat of generic entry on its lead narcolepsy product, Xyrem. Stifel however, thinks the company's extensive patent estate and proprietary distribution system should provide adequate protection at least through 2019.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (UNXL -17%) tanks again after SA contributor Seth Shaw posts pictures of UniBoss touch...

    UniPixel (UNXL -17%) tanks again after SA contributor Seth Shaw posts pictures of UniBoss touch sensor film that he considers indicative of poor quality. Seth: "The product does not work. The lines are too visible. No consumer electronics company would approve this..." He also shows a picture of a UniBoss demo unit with broken lines, and says talks with engineers and ex-employees revealed doubts about UniPixel's ability to mass-produce UniBoss. An industry consultant and engineers at Synaptics, Texas Instruments, and private Touch International all reportedly made technical complaints; they often related to visible lines.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 4 Comments
  • ROAN

    Renewed worries over cash flow? MLP liquidation pressure? There's no apparent news behind...

    Renewed worries over cash flow? MLP liquidation pressure? There's no apparent news behind today's weakness in Linn Energy (LINE -3.5%), LinnCo (LNCO -3.7%) and Berry Petroleum (BRY -2.8%). LINE and LNCO plan to acquire BRY for $4.3B, the first-ever acquisition of a public C-Corp by an upstream LLC or MLP.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 23 Comments
  • SPLK

    Splunk (SPLK +2.3%) has turned positive as the sell-side gives a thumb-up to its FQ1 revenue...

    Splunk (SPLK +2.3%) has turned positive as the sell-side gives a thumb-up to its FQ1 revenue beat and in-line guidance, given a tough spending environment. Though reiterating a Market Perform due to valuation (Splunk trades at 17.5x FY14E sales), FBR praises the machine data analytics leader's "prudent approach to guidance and [believes] that from both a secular and a product perspective, Splunk is in the right place at the right time." On the earnings call, Splunk touted its growing ecosystem, noting there are 400+ apps and add-ons now available on its splunkbase site. International only made up 21% of FQ1 sales, and 132 $100K+ orders were recorded (up from 72 a year ago).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • PLL-OLD

    Shares of Pall Corp. (PLL-OLD -3.3%) slip after FQ3 revenue comes in light. More from the...

    Shares of Pall Corp. (PLL-OLD -3.3%) slip after FQ3 revenue comes in light. More from the report: CEO Larry Kingsley calls the results "pretty solid" given the economic environment. Life Sciences Food & Beverage sales slide 21% Y/Y due to weak capital spending and revenues in the industrial segment fall 7% Y/Y. Outlook: The company narrows its EPS guidance range for the full year to $2.95-3.05 versus consensus of $3.07. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • HAE

    Haemonetics (HAE -1%) slips on a limp coverage intiation from Goldman Sachs this morning,...

    Haemonetics (HAE -1%) slips on a limp coverage intiation from Goldman Sachs this morning, starting the shares with a Neutral rating and a price target of $47.00. Goldman says the stock is already trading at a premium to both the S&P 500 and its sector peers, and it "limited upside to consensus numbers with management's longterm guidance already contemplating top-line growth ahead of recent trends."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • SNMP

    Constellation Energy (CEP +11.7%) shares surge after the company announces it has refinanced its...

    Constellation Energy (CEP +11.7%) shares surge after the company announces it has refinanced its reserve-based credit facility and expanded its borrowing capacity.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • AVAV

    AeroVironment (AVAV -2.5%) says it's implemented an organizational realignment and workforce...

    AeroVironment (AVAV -2.5%) says it's implemented an organizational realignment and workforce reduction within its Unmanned Aircraft Systems and Efficient Energy Systems business segments, in response to continued delays in U.S. government UAS procurements and sluggish sales growth in its its EES business due to slow plug-in electric vehicle adoption. The cost of the restructuring is estimated to be around $1.1M, primarily in severance payments. AVAV will record the charge in its FQ1 report ending July 27.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • AIG

    More on AIG: Shares are off 2.5% following news the Chinese buyers of its aircraft-leasing unit...

    More on AIG: Shares are off 2.5% following news the Chinese buyers of its aircraft-leasing unit (ILFC) failed to come up with a 10% deposit by the May 15 deadline. Under terms of the $4.2B deal, AIG has the right to back out of the sale. This may please some who thought ILFC was being sold too cheaply, but if AIG could have gotten a better price, wouldn't it have gotten a better price? Stay tuned.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 2 Comments
  • PLL-OLD

    Pall (PLL-OLD -2.8%) dips after posting a mixed FQ3 report yesterday. Net earnings slid 7.4% Y/Y...

    Pall (PLL-OLD -2.8%) dips after posting a mixed FQ3 report yesterday. Net earnings slid 7.4% Y/Y on losses from discontinued operations and weakening revenue in its industrial segment. Gross margin widened to 52.1% from 50.8%, as overhead costs dropped by 7.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • ANFI

    The list of concerns on Amira Nature Foods (ANFI -3.3%) is long and varied, according to SA...

    The list of concerns on Amira Nature Foods (ANFI -3.3%) is long and varied, according to SA contributor Howie Man. A public listing under the reduced terms of the JOBS Act doesn't change the fact that the company shouldn't be grouped into the natural/organic mix of stocks along with Hain's Celestial and Annie's - but should be considered a "low quality, commodity business." warns Man.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • GHM

    Graham (GHM -1.3%) slips this morning as the vacuum and heat transfer equipment company reported...

    Graham (GHM -1.3%) slips this morning as the vacuum and heat transfer equipment company reported FQ4 earnings beat Street estimates, but gave a cautious outlook going forward. Increased refining shipments drove a slight 1.7% rise in total revenue for the quarter, but orders declined by 58% Y/Y. Backlog also slid to $85.8M, compared with $90.7M Q/Q and $94.9M Y/Y, respectively. Looking forward, the company expects FY14 revenues to be $100M- $115M, below the Street view of $118.65M.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • TSL

    Japan’s solar shipments have nearly tripled during the past 12 months as its government...

    Japan’s solar shipments have nearly tripled during the past 12 months as its government attempts to boost the use of clean energy, but Trina Solar (TSL -2.7%) hasn’t been able to take advantage, according to a bearish report from Axiom which says Q1 results show TSL is lagging JA Solar (JASO -2.6%) and Yingli Green Energy (YGE -3.5%) in penetrating Japanese markets.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • CLSN

    Celsion (CLSN -6.8%) tumbles to $1.66 after announcing a $9.83M direct offering, selling 6.26M...

    Celsion (CLSN -6.8%) tumbles to $1.66 after announcing a $9.83M direct offering, selling 6.26M shares offered by a health care fund at $1.57 each. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM | 4 Comments
  • SRPT

    Shares of Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT -2.4%) fall for a second day and are now down ~6% since...

    Shares of Sarepta Therapeutics (SRPT -2.4%) fall for a second day and are now down ~6% since late Thursday after comments from CEO Chris Garabedian at the dbAccess Health Care Conference (transcript) fail to inspire confidence regarding regulatory progress for the company's muscular dystrophy program. "It looks like the meeting that we were hoping to have calendered by the end of June [will] be calendered in Q3 based on [the FDA's] scheduling," Garabedian says, referring to the application for accelerated approval of eteplirsen (I, II, III).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM | 5 Comments
  • AWAY

    Piper upgrades HomeAway (AWAY +3.4%) to Overweight on a belief 2014 pricing growth will be...

    Piper upgrades HomeAway (AWAY +3.4%) to Overweight on a belief 2014 pricing growth will be better than expected. The vacation rental site's shares are up 42% YTD, aided by a rebounding housing market. 14.9% of the float was shorted as of April 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • MNGA

    MagneGas (NASDAQ:MNGA) -14.9% premarket after announcing a public offering of common stock and...

    MagneGas (NASDAQ:MNGA) -14.9% premarket after announcing a public offering of common stock and warrants at a combined price of $0.90/share.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • OVTI

    Premarket gainers: OVTI +21%. NBG +19%. OTC:AFFY +8%. CLSN +8%. KKD +7%. ETRM +6%. LEDS +6%. GES...

    Premarket gainers: OVTI +21%. NBG +19%. OTC:AFFY +8%. CLSN +8%. KKD +7%. ETRM +6%. LEDS +6%. GES +5%.
    Losers: PANW -13%. PLM -12%. MHGC -7%. NMR -6%. 
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (NASDAQ:MLNX) -3.9% following a downgrade to Neutral from UBS. In spite of bad earnings...

    Mellanox (NASDAQ:MLNX) -3.9% following a downgrade to Neutral from UBS. In spite of bad earnings news, shares have largely been in a holding pattern in 2013 after tumbling last fall.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • AIG

    Is AIG's sale of ILFC falling apart? The insurer says (8-K) the consortium making the purchase...

    Is AIG's sale of ILFC falling apart? The insurer says (8-K) the consortium making the purchase missed a deadline for a deposit payment. Shares -1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM | 4 Comments
  • DNDN

    For what it's worth — which, after Q1's sales figures (I, II, III) may not be much, at...

    For what it's worth — which, after Q1's sales figures (I, II, III) may not be much, at least in terms of analysts' opinions — Dendreon (NASDAQ:DNDN) says six abstracts highlighting data from Phase 2 trials with Provenge will be presented at the the 49th Annual Meeting of the American Society of Clinical Oncology. The news seems to be giving the stock a boost as shares are +4.41% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • NFLX

    Curb your enthusiasm. That's the advice from Schaeffer's Investment Research to traders giddy...

    Curb your enthusiasm. That's the advice from Schaeffer's Investment Research to traders giddy over Netflix's (NASDAQ:NFLX) inclusion in the Nasdaq 100. The track record for companies tagged for the index is spotty and Netflix's own history suggests it does just well as from the outside looking in. NFLX +1.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM
  • KKD

    Krispy Kreme (KKD) execs made it quite clear during the firm's earnings call that doughnut sales...

    Krispy Kreme (KKD) execs made it quite clear during the firm's earnings call that doughnut sales are "doggone strong" but it might have been premium coffee that really set up the company for a smashing performance (I, II) in Q1. Beverage unit sales were up a solid 5% Y/Y during the period for the company, but dollar sales shot up 16% as the company pushed more higher-priced coffee drinks. KKD +12.1% premarket. (CC transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • HOG

    Shares of Harley Davidson (NYSE:HOG) fall 1.6% premarket with a warning out from UBS that sales...

    Shares of Harley Davidson (NYSE:HOG) fall 1.6% premarket with a warning out from UBS that sales in April fell 10%.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM
  • PANW

    Nobody is yet downgrading Palo Alto Networds (NYSE:PANW) following last night's earnings (shares...

    Nobody is yet downgrading Palo Alto Networds (NYSE:PANW) following last night's earnings (shares off 15% premarket). It's a significant over-reaction, says Goldman (which has the stock on its Conviction Buy list). Macro took a bite, says Morgan Stanley, but the growth story remains compelling. They remain buyers with a $65 PT.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 AM
  • EWJ

    The weekend may have started in Japan but the volatility in its stock markets continues, with...

    The weekend may have started in Japan but the volatility in its stock markets continues, with Nikkei 225 (NYSEARCA:EWJ) futures -2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:32 AM
  • EZA

    Emerging-market currencies are taking a battering, with the South African rand (NYSEARCA:EZA)...

    Emerging-market currencies are taking a battering, with the South African rand (NYSEARCA:EZA) receiving particular punishment. What began as a "drip drip of currency weakness" (WSJ) on concerns about the end of the Fed's QE program has turned into a flood as countries' various problems become exposed. The rand is down 6.3% since last week and the Turkish lira is -2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 AM | 1 Comment

  • European shares pull back from yesterday's gains - possibly due to end-of-month profit-taking -...

    European shares pull back from yesterday's gains - possibly due to end-of-month profit-taking - ahead of eurozone unemployment and inflation reports, and consumer data in the U.S. EU Stoxx 50 -1.1%, London -0.8%, Paris -1.2%, Frankfurt -1%, Milan -0.9%, Madrid -1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 AM
  • EWJ

    The Nikkei 225 (NYSEARCA:EWJ) closed +1.4% today after several volatile sessions, but that's not...

    The Nikkei 225 (NYSEARCA:EWJ) closed +1.4% today after several volatile sessions, but that's not enough to prevent the index from ending May 0.6% lower, its first monthly loss in ten. Stocks rallied following a report that Japan's $1T Pension Investment Fund could increase its equity allocation. Elsewhere in Asia, Hong Kong -0.2% and China -0.7% ahead of manufacturing data, and India -1.4% after GDP figures.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 AM
